body.p:
Wishing you the compliments
of the season, & that you may be spared many
more years as a teacher & writer in Israel,
against the attacks of those who wish to break
down Judaism, I must apologize for not
answering your letter before, but have been
very much engaged in business & not much in
London until now, I made some inquiries with
regard to your offer some time back about printing
a certain number of your Bibles at a low price
but could not learn why the matter fell to the
ground, no one appearing to know, I named it to
Dr. Adler & he said we wanted a cheap Hebrew
& English edition for the use of Schools, as there
was not such a work to be had, & the hebrew ought
not to be neglected, he also said he appreciated
you very much, & would always be happy to be of
any service he could to you. If you should consider
it advisable to publish a cheap Hebrew & English
edition of the whole Bible I would advise you to
lay your plans before Dr. Adler, & correspond with
him on the subject, & also make the price the
lowest possible figure you can.

I have read & heard with great joy, the foundation
of an American Board of Delegates, it is my
greatest wish it will prosper & that all
the Orthodox Synagogues that have not yet
joined will do so, including the Old, New
York, Portuguese congregation, which ought to

have been the first on the list, I consider the
establishment of this board, the first blow at
Reform, it has already showed the weakness of
those new light Preachers & congregations, inasmuch
as they are opposed to the foundation of that body,
& have refused (although invited to send
delegates) to join the association, for fear we
must come to the conclusion that the many different
views of each reform congregation, (for they are
not united themselves) may be crushed by the
United votes of all the true Jewish Orthodox
Congregations, Is it not strange that these very
reform Preachers & congregations, who branded the
Board of Deputies of British Jews with the
name of a Bigoted body, at the time they would
not admit delegates from the Margaret Street
congregation into their Society, are the very ones
who now refuse the invitation to send delegates
to the American Body, I congratulate the body
also with having chosen you for one of their
Vice Presidents, as many years you have wished
such a Society to be established, & may God
bless you that you will be spared to see a
great deal of good emanate from the united
efforts of all true Jewish congregations &
that the blasphemy & Infidelity preached &
practised throughout a great many of the new
reform congregations may be anihilated for ever
& that they may return again to true Judaism,
Yesterday being Penitential Sabbath Revd. Dr.
Adler preached in the Great Synagogue, taking
for his text, 2nd Samuel, Chapter 12 explaining
that David had committed a great sin, Nathan the

Prophet came to him he acknowledged the crime by saying
I have sinned, Nathan then said, he should not die
but that his sin was put aside, he did not say
his sin was forgiven, but put aside to see if he really
repented, that from that time he never committed
a single Sin until the day of his death, & therfore
truly repented & was forgiven, showing that our sins
are laid aside in the same manner, & that if we
truly repent these days, the Almighty will forgive us also. Is not this a contrast to the name given
by the reform preachers to David on account
of this crime, “the greatest sinner in Israel.”
Mr. Herman Adler B. A. second son of the Chief Rabbi
Preached on the first day of New Year in the
New Synagogue, taking for his text Jeremiah
Chapter 10. Verse 16. he also lectures in that
Synagogue on Day of Atonement, he is a young
man fit to set an example to some older
preachers in America, I will now bring this
to a close wishing you well over your fast
& that you may be inscribed in the book
of life. I remain
